showScoreExcerpt:
"A work of considerable wit and high style, 'King Charles III' is best enjoyed for the audacity of its conception, the formal brilliance of its verse dialogue, and a gallery of characters brought to life by an unusually gifted cast. Presiding over it all is Tim Pigott-Smith, whose Charles is a confounding, yet utterly convincing, mixture of self-doubt and arroganceâ€¦In its later stretches, the play occasionally seems tendentious, even a tad too certain of its importance."
